title: Contributor Code of Conduct
text: contributors maintainers project, pledge respect people contribute reporting issues, posting feature requests, updating documentation, submitting pull requests patches, activities. committed making participation project harassment-free experience everyone, regardless level experience, gender, gender identity expression, sexual orientation, disability, personal appearance, body size, race, ethnicity, age, religion. Examples unacceptable behavior participants include use sexual language imagery, derogatory comments personal attacks, trolling, public private harassment, insults, unprofessional conduct. Project maintainers right responsibility remove, edit, reject comments, commits, code, wiki edits, issues, contributions aligned Code Conduct. Project maintainers follow Code Conduct may removed project team. Instances abusive, harassing, otherwise unacceptable behavior may reported opening issue contacting one project maintainers. Code Conduct adapted Contributor Covenant, version 1.0.0, available http://contributor-covenant.org/version/1/0/0/

title: The depmap data
text: depmap package aims provide reproducible research framework cancer dependency data described Tsherniak, Aviad, et al. “Defining cancer dependency map.” Cell 170.3 (2017): 564-576.. data found depmap package formatted facilitate use common R packages dplyr ggplot2. hope package allow researchers easily mine, explore visually illustrate dependency data taken Depmap cancer genomic dependency study.

title: The depmap data
text: install depmap, BiocManager Bioconductor Project Package Manager required. BiocManager already installed, need done beforehand. Type (within R) install.packages(“BiocManager”) (needs done just .) depmap package fully depends ExperimentHub Bioconductor package, allows data accessed package stored retrieved cloud.

title: The depmap data
text: depmap package currently contains eight datasets available ExperimentHub. data found R package converted “wide” format .csv file “long” format .rda file. None values taken original datasets changed, although columns re-arranged. Descriptions changes made described Details section querying relevant dataset. dataset ExperimentHub accession number, (e.g. EH2260 refers rnai dataset 19Q1 release).
code: ## create ExperimentHub query object eh <- ExperimentHub() query(eh, "depmap") ## ExperimentHub with 82 records ## # snapshotDate(): 2024-04-29 ## # $dataprovider: Broad Institute ## # $species: Homo sapiens ## # $rdataclass: tibble ## # additional mcols(): taxonomyid, genome, description, ## #   coordinate_1_based, maintainer, rdatadateadded, preparerclass, tags, ## #   rdatapath, sourceurl, sourcetype  ## # retrieve records with, e.g., 'object[["EH2260"]]'  ##  ##            title              ##   EH2260 | rnai_19Q1          ##   EH2261 | crispr_19Q1        ##   EH2262 | copyNumber_19Q1    ##   EH2263 | RPPA_19Q1          ##   EH2264 | TPM_19Q1           ##   ...      ...                ##   EH7555 | copyNumber_22Q2    ##   EH7556 | TPM_22Q2           ##   EH7557 | mutationCalls_22Q2 ##   EH7558 | metadata_22Q2      ##   EH7559 | achilles_22Q2

title: The depmap data
text: rnai dataset contains combined genetic dependency data RNAi - induced gene knockdown select genes cancer cell lines. data corresponds D2_combined_genetic_dependency_scores.csv file. Specific rnai datasets can accessed, rnai_19Q1 EH number. recent rnai dataset can automatically loaded R using depmap_rnai function.

title: The depmap data
text: crispr dataset contains (batch corrected CERES inferred gene effect) CRISPR-Cas9 knockout data select genes cancer cell lines. data corresponds gene_effect_corrected.csv file. title: The depmap data
text: desired, original data depmap package derived can downloaded Broad Institute website. instructions download files data transformed loaded depmap package can found make_data.R file found ./inst/scripts. (noted original uncompressed .csv files > 1.5GB total take moderate amount time download remotely.)

title: The depmap data
text: addition re-packaged files, package also allows download original files provided DepMap project Figshare. list datasets available dmsets() function: check datasets quarter 2020 available searching "20Q" datasets titles: Let’s focus PRISM Repurposing 20Q2 Dataset dataset, identifier 20564034. list files available dmfiles() function: want find files PRISM Repurposing 20Q2 Dataset identified , filter files dataset_id: Let’s now focus prism-repurposing-20q2-primary-screen-cell-line-info.csv file. can filter name downloaded dmget(): dmget() function first check hasn’t already downloaded cached depmap cache directory (see ?dmCache()). , retrieve . Otherwise, download file store package cache directory. return location cached file. Given file csv format, can directly open read_csv(): also possible pass multiple rows dmfiles() table dmget() retrieve multiple file paths. , let’s get README.txt files 2020:

title: Using the depmap data
text: depmap package aims provide reproducible research framework cancer dependency data described Tsherniak, Aviad, et al. “Defining cancer dependency map.” Cell 170.3 (2017): 564-576.. data found depmap package formatted facilitate use common R packages dplyr ggplot2. hope package allow researchers easily mine, explore visually illustrate dependency data taken Depmap cancer genomic dependency study.

title: Using the depmap data
text: Perhaps interesting datasets found within depmap package relate cancer gene dependency score, rnai crispr. datasets contain score expressing vital particular gene terms lethal knockout/knockdown gene target cell line. example, highly negative dependency score implies cell line highly dependent gene. Load necessary libaries. Load rnai, crispr copyNumber datasets visualization. Note: datasets listed 19Q3 release. Newer datasets, 20Q1 release available. importing depmap data R environment, data can mined effectively. example, one interested researching soft tissue sarcomas wanted search cancer cell lines gene greatest dependency, possible accomplish task using data manipulation visualization tools dplyr ggplot2. , rnai dataset selected cell lines “SOFT_TISSUE” CCLE name, displaying list highest dependency scores. gene RPL14 appears several times top dependencies scores, may make interesting candidate target. , plot rnai data displayed histogram showing distribution dependency scores gene RPL14.  complex plot rnai data, shown involves plotting distribution dependency scores gene RPL14 major type cancer, highlighting nature mutations gene cancer cell lines (e.g. COSMIC hotspots, damaging, etc.). Notice plot reflects overall distribution two dimensions.  boxplot displaying expression values gene RPL14 lineage:  High dependency, high expression genes likely interesting research targets. plot expression vs rnai gene dependency Rhabdomyosarcoma Sarcoma:  selection genes shown lowest depenency scores, also displaying gene expression TPM last column. boxplot displaying log genomic copy number gene RPL14 lineage:
code: library("dplyr") library("ggplot2") library("viridis") library("tibble") library("gridExtra") library("stringr") library("depmap") library("ExperimentHub") ## create ExperimentHub query object eh <- ExperimentHub() query(eh, "depmap") ## ExperimentHub with 82 records ## # snapshotDate(): 2024-04-29 ## # $dataprovider: Broad Institute ## # $species: Homo sapiens ## # $rdataclass: tibble ## # additional mcols(): taxonomyid, genome, description, ## #   coordinate_1_based, maintainer, rdatadateadded, preparerclass, tags, ## #   rdatapath, sourceurl, sourcetype  ## # retrieve records with, e.g., 'object[["EH2260"]]'  ##  ##            title              ##   EH2260 | rnai_19Q1          ##   EH2261 | crispr_19Q1        ##   EH2262 | copyNumber_19Q1    ##   EH2263 | RPPA_19Q1          ##   EH2264 | TPM_19Q1           ##   ...      ...                ##   EH7555 | copyNumber_22Q2    ##   EH7556 | TPM_22Q2           ##   EH7557 | mutationCalls_22Q2 ##   EH7558 | metadata_22Q2      ##   EH7559 | achilles_22Q2 rnai <- eh[["EH3080"]] mutationCalls <- eh[["EH3085"]] metadata <- eh[["EH3086"]] TPM <- eh[["EH3084"]] copyNumber <- eh[["EH3082"]] # crispr <- eh[["EH3081"]] # drug_sensitivity <- eh[["EH3087"]] ## list of dependency scores rnai |>     dplyr::select(cell_line, gene_name, dependency) |>     dplyr::filter(stringr::str_detect(cell_line, "SOFT_TISSUE")) |>     dplyr::arrange(dependency) |>     head(10) ## # A tibble: 10 × 3 ##    cell_line          gene_name dependency ##    <chr>              <chr>          <dbl> ##  1 FUJI_SOFT_TISSUE   RPL14          -3.60 ##  2 SJRH30_SOFT_TISSUE RAN            -3.41 ##  3 SJRH30_SOFT_TISSUE RPL14          -3.36 ##  4 SJRH30_SOFT_TISSUE RBX1           -3.31 ##  5 HS729_SOFT_TISSUE  PSMA3          -3.22 ##  6 SJRH30_SOFT_TISSUE RUVBL2         -3.13 ##  7 KYM1_SOFT_TISSUE   RPL14          -3.03 ##  8 RH41_SOFT_TISSUE   RBX1           -3.01 ##  9 HS729_SOFT_TISSUE  NUTF2          -2.90 ## 10 SJRH30_SOFT_TISSUE NUTF2          -2.85 ## Basic histogram rnai |>     dplyr::select(gene, gene_name, dependency) |>     dplyr::filter(gene_name == "RPL14") |>     ggplot(aes(x = dependency)) +     geom_histogram() +     geom_vline(xintercept = mean(rnai$dependency, na.rm = TRUE),                linetype = "dotted", color = "red") +     ggtitle("Histogram of dependency scores for gene RPL14") meta_rnai <- metadata |>     dplyr::select(depmap_id, lineage) |>     dplyr::full_join(rnai, by = "depmap_id") |>     dplyr::filter(gene_name == "RPL14") |>     dplyr::full_join((mutationCalls |>                       dplyr::select(depmap_id, entrez_id,                                     is_cosmic_hotspot, var_annotation)),                      by = c("depmap_id", "entrez_id"))  p1 <- meta_rnai |>       ggplot(aes(x = dependency, y = lineage)) +       geom_point(alpha = 0.4, size = 0.5) +       geom_point(data = subset(          meta_rnai, var_annotation == "damaging"), color = "red") +       geom_point(data = subset(          meta_rnai, var_annotation == "other non-conserving"), color = "blue") +       geom_point(data = subset(          meta_rnai, var_annotation == "other conserving"), color = "cyan") +       geom_point(data = subset(          meta_rnai, is_cosmic_hotspot == TRUE), color = "orange") +       geom_vline(xintercept=mean(meta_rnai$dependency, na.rm = TRUE),                  linetype = "dotted", color = "red") +       ggtitle("Scatterplot of dependency scores for gene RPL14 by lineage")  p1 metadata |>     dplyr::select(depmap_id, lineage) |>     dplyr::full_join(TPM, by = "depmap_id") |>     dplyr::filter(gene_name == "RPL14") |>     ggplot(aes(x = lineage, y = expression, fill = lineage)) +     geom_boxplot(outlier.alpha = 0.1) +     ggtitle("Boxplot of expression values for gene RPL14 by lineage") +     theme(axis.text.x = element_text(angle = 45, hjust=1)) +     theme(legend.position = "none") ## expression vs rnai gene dependency for Rhabdomyosarcoma Sarcoma sarcoma <- metadata |>     dplyr::select(depmap_id, cell_line,                   primary_disease, subtype_disease) |>     dplyr::filter(primary_disease == "Sarcoma",                   subtype_disease == "Rhabdomyosarcoma")  rnai_sub <- rnai |>     dplyr::select(depmap_id, gene, gene_name, dependency) tpm_sub <- TPM |>     dplyr::select(depmap_id, gene, gene_name, expression)  sarcoma_dep <- sarcoma |>     dplyr::left_join(rnai_sub, by = "depmap_id") |>     dplyr::select(-cell_line, -primary_disease,                   -subtype_disease, -gene_name)  sarcoma_exp <- sarcoma |>     dplyr::left_join(tpm_sub, by = "depmap_id")  sarcoma_dat_exp <- dplyr::full_join(sarcoma_dep, sarcoma_exp,                                     by = c("depmap_id", "gene")) |>     dplyr::filter(!is.na(expression))  p2 <- ggplot(data = sarcoma_dat_exp, aes(x = dependency, y = expression)) +     geom_point(alpha = 0.4, size = 0.5) +     geom_vline(xintercept=mean(sarcoma_dat_exp$dependency, na.rm = TRUE),                linetype = "dotted", color = "red") +     geom_hline(yintercept=mean(sarcoma_dat_exp$expression, na.rm = TRUE),                linetype = "dotted", color = "red") +     ggtitle("Scatterplot of rnai dependency vs expression values for gene")  p2 + theme(axis.text.x = element_text(angle = 45)) sarcoma_dat_exp |>     dplyr::select(cell_line, gene_name, dependency, expression) |>     dplyr::arrange(dependency) |>     head(10) ## # A tibble: 10 × 4 ##    cell_line        gene_name dependency expression ##    <chr>            <chr>          <dbl>      <dbl> ##  1 A204_SOFT_TISSUE RPS27A         -2.62      10.6  ##  2 A204_SOFT_TISSUE RPL14          -2.34      10.0  ##  3 A204_SOFT_TISSUE RPL7           -2.23      11.5  ##  4 A204_SOFT_TISSUE RPS16          -2.08      11.2  ##  5 A204_SOFT_TISSUE RPS15A         -1.92      11.6  ##  6 A204_SOFT_TISSUE RBX1           -1.91       6.51 ##  7 A204_SOFT_TISSUE SF3B2          -1.80       7.47 ##  8 A204_SOFT_TISSUE RPL5           -1.79      10.7  ##  9 A204_SOFT_TISSUE RPS3A          -1.77      11.4  ## 10 A204_SOFT_TISSUE RPL13          -1.68      11.6 metadata |>     dplyr::select(depmap_id, lineage) |>     dplyr::full_join(copyNumber, by = "depmap_id") |>     dplyr::filter(gene_name == "RPL14") |>     ggplot(aes(x = lineage, y = log_copy_number, fill = lineage)) +     geom_boxplot(outlier.alpha = 0.1) +     ggtitle("Boxplot of log copy number for gene RPL14 by lineage") +     theme(axis.text.x = element_text(angle = 45, hjust = 1)) +     theme(legend.position = "none")

title: DepMap Dataset and Files — DepMapFiles
text: Two tibbles provided give access DepMap data, shared Broad Institute's DepMap project Figshare (https://figshare.com/authors/Broad_DepMap/5514062). - [dmsets()] function returns tibble DepMap   datasets. dataset described title, unique   identifier, number files contains, Figshare URL,   `DepMapDataset` object contains details   dataset. - [dmfiles()] function returns tibble DepMap   files. file described dataset identifier,   unique identifier, name, size (bytes), download URL,   md5 hash mime type. - Depmap data files can downloaded [dmget()] function,   takes input tibble data.frame depmap files   `dmfiles`. Files downloaded automatically   package's central cache. See [dmCache()].

title: DepMap Dataset and Files — DepMapFiles
code: DepMapDataset(id)  DepMapFiles(x)  dmFileNames(object)  dmTitle(object)  dmNumFiles(object)  dmget(dmtab, cache = dmCache())  dmfiles()  dmsets()

title: DepMap Dataset and Files — DepMapFiles
text: id `numeric()` one multiple DepMap dataset identifier(s). Note `id` converted integer. Missing values permitted. x either `numeric()` passed `DepMapDataset` instance (list ) `DepMapDataset`. object instance class `DepMapDataset`. dmtab `tibble` `data.frame` containing file downloaded, [dmfiles()], created [DepMapFiles()]. expected contain `"name"`, `"id"` `"dowload_url"` variables. cache Object class [BiocFileCache()]. Default use central `depmap` cache returned [dmCache()], users can use cache.

title: DepMap Dataset and Files — DepMapFiles
text: `DepMapDataset` class stores informtion describing depmap dataset, stored Figshare (articles, called ). [DepMapDataset()] constructor requires one multiple dataset identifiers returns one list instances. following accessors available: - [dmFileNames()] returns dataset's filenames. - [dmTitle()] returns dataset's title. - [dmNumFiles()] returns number files dataset. (used construct main depmap dataset tibble.) tibble describing files depmap dataset can cretated [DepMapFiles()] function. either takes one multiple dataset idenifiers, one list `DepMapDataset` instances [DepMapDataset()] [DepMapFiles()] functions mostly used internally, create `dmsets` `dmfiles` tibbles. recent dataset available Figshare (yet) `depmap` package, user might create depmap files table download files, /open [GitHub issue](https://github.com/UCLouvain-CBIO/depmap) new data added maintainer(s). information retrieved Figshare using API, described https://docs.figshare.com.

title: DepMap Dataset and Files — DepMapFiles
text: Adding new datasets simple. new dataset (Article, called Figshare) identified Broad Institute's [DepMap project Figshare](https://figshare.com/authors/Broad_DepMap/5514062), one needs add dataset's URL `depmapURLs` vector [`inst/extdata/make-dmfiles.R`](https://github.com/UCLouvain-CBIO/depmap/blob/master/inst/scripts/make-dmfiles.R), re-run script update `dmsets.rds.` `dmfiles.rds` files `inst/extdata`. Feel free send GitHub pull request open [GitHub issue](https://github.com/UCLouvain-CBIO/depmap) new data added maintainer(s).

title: RPPA_19Q3 — RPPA
text: `RPPA` dataset contains 19Q3 CCLE Reverse Phase Protein Array (RPPA) cellular model expression data. dataset includes data 214 genes, 899 cancer cell lines, 28 primary diseases 28 lineages. columns `RPPA` : `depmap_id`, foreign key corresponding cancer cell lineage, `cell_line` contains common CCLE name cancer cell lines, `gene` contains knockdown gene expression, `antibody` containing name knocked gene `expression` containing numerical protein expression data. dataset can loaded R environment `depmap_RPPA` function.

text: data frame 192386 rows 4 variables: depmap_id cancer cell line foreign key (.e. "ACH-000001") cell_line CCLE name cancer cell line (.e. "NIHOVCAR3_OVARY") antibody Name antibody targeting protein (.e. "14-3-3_beta") expression Observed expression via RPPA protein coding genes

title: TPM_22Q2 — TPM
text: `TPM` dataset contains 22Q2 CCLE "Transcript Per Million" RNAseq gene expression data protein coding genes. dataset includes data 19221 genes, 1406 cell lines, 33 primary diseases 30 lineages. columns `TPM` : `depmap_id`, foreign key corresponding cancer cell lineage, `cell_line` common CCLE name cancer cell lines, `gene` containing HUGO gene name knockdown gene along ensembl ID#, `gene_name` containing HUGO gene name `ensembl_id` containing ensembl ID# `rna_expression` contains numerical protein coding gene expression change scale (log2(TPM+1)). dataset can loaded R environment `depmap_TPM` function.

what: depmap: Cancer Dependency Map Data Package — depmap
title: depmap: Cancer Dependency Map Data Package — depmap
text: depmap package data package accesses datsets Broad Institute DepMap cancer dependency study using ExperimentHub. Datasets current release available, including RNAI CRISPR-Cas9 gene knockout screens quantifying genetic dependency select cancer cell lines. Additional datasets also available pertaining log copy number genes select cell lines, protein expression cell lines measured reverse phase protein lysate microarray (RPPA), 'Transcript Per Million' (TPM) data, chemical dependecy (drug_sensativity), mass spectrometry proteomic quantification (proteomic) well supplementary datasets contain metadata mutation calls datasets found current release. package updated quarterly basis incorporate latest Broad Institute DepMap Public cancer dependency datasets. data made available package generated Broad Institute DepMap research purposes intended clinical use. data distributed Creative Commons license (Attribution 4.0 International (CC 4.0)).

title: drug_sensitivity_21Q2 — drug_sensitivity
text: `drug_sensitivity` dataset contains 19Q3 replicate collapsed logfold change values relative DMSO, corrected experimental confounders using ComBat. dataset contains information refering 4686 compounds, 578 cell lines, 23 primary diseases 25 lineages. dataset part SIGMA Re-purposing release contains small molecule viability datasets generated using Broad Re-purposing Library PRISM multiplexed cell-line viability assay. columns `drug_sensitivity` : `depmap_id` foreign key corresponding cancer cell lineage, `cell_line` common CCLE name cancer cell lines, `compound` synonym drug compound, `dependency` contains numerical dependency score values pair genes cell lines. Compounded metadata also added.

BRD-A00077618-236-07-6::2.5::HTS) dependency numerical depenency score compound cell line broad_id Broad ID compound (.e. BRD-A00077618-236-07-6) name Standard chemical name (.e. 8-bromo-cGMP) dose Dose compound screen_id Broad ID compound (.e. HTS) moa Mechanism action (.e.
